user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, osal_priority_t new_priority)
{
    int os_priority;
    int ret;

    OS_impl_task_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_task_table, *token);

    if (POSIX_GlobalVars.EnableTaskPriorities)
    {
        /* Change OSAL priority into a priority that will work for this OS */
        os_priority = OS_PriorityRemap(new_priority);

        /*
        ** Set priority
        */
        ret = pthread_setschedprio(impl->id, os_priority);
        if (ret != 0)
        {
            OS_DEBUG("pthread_setschedprio: Task ID = %lu, prio = %d, err = %s\n",
                     OS_ObjectIdToInteger(OS_ObjectIdFromToken(token)), os_priority, strerror(ret));
            return OS_ERROR;
        }
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl:
static int OS_PriorityRemap(osal_priority_t InputPri)
{
    int OutputPri;

    if (InputPri == 0)
    {
        /* use the "MAX" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=0 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax;
    }
    else if (InputPri >= OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY)
    {
        /* use the "MIN" local priority only for OSAL tasks with priority=255 */
        OutputPri = POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin;
    }
    else
    {
        /*
         * Spread the remainder of OSAL priorities over the remainder of local priorities
         *
         * Note OSAL priorities use the VxWorks style with zero being the
         * highest and OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY being the lowest, this inverts it
         */
        OutputPri = (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 1) - (int)InputPri;

        OutputPri *= (POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMax - POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin) - 2;
        OutputPri += OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY / 2;
        OutputPri /= (OS_MAX_TASK_PRIORITY - 2);
        OutputPri += POSIX_GlobalVars.PriLimits.PriorityMin + 1;
    }

    return OutputPri;
}
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static inline osal_id_t OS_ObjectIdFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_id;
}
...
static inline unsigned long OS_ObjectIdToInteger(osal_id_t object_id)
{
#ifdef OSAL_OMIT_DEPRECATED
    return object_id.v;
#else
    return object_id;
#endif
}
...
int32 OS_TaskSetPriority(osal_id_t task_id, osal_priority_t new_priority)
{
    int32                      return_code;
    OS_object_token_t          token;
    OS_task_internal_record_t *task;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, task_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        task = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_task_table, token);

        return_code = OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl(&token, new_priority);

        if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            /* Use the abstracted priority, not the OS one */
            /* Change the priority in the table as well */
            task->priority = new_priority;
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No code fragments in the provided snippets exhibit direct or indirect self-calls of OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl. The call graph from the shown code is:
- OS_TaskSetPriority -> OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl
- OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl -> OS_PriorityRemap, pthread_setschedprio, OS_ObjectIdFromToken, OS_ObjectIdToInteger, strerror, and OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET (macro)
Each of these called routines, as provided, does not call back into OS_TaskSetPriority_Impl or OS_TaskSetPriority:
- OS_PriorityRemap (static function body shown) contains only local computations and returns an integer; it does not call any other functions in these snippets.
- pthread_setschedprio is a POSIX library call and will not call back into these application functions.
- OS_ObjectIdFromToken and OS_ObjectIdToInteger are simple inline accessors (returning fields) and do not invoke other functions.
- OS_DEBUG is defined as an empty macro in the provided code, so it does nothing; in this translation it cannot introduce recursion.
- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET is a macro used to index the object table; no implementation was provided, but typical macros expand to table indexing and do not call back into task-priority functions. If OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET instead expands to or invokes a function, that specific expansion should be reviewed — however, nothing in the supplied code indicates such a call.
Given these facts, there is no evidence of direct or indirect recursion in the supplied code fragments, so no suspicious fragments need to be reported for MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 investigation.
